org.cougaar.planning.ldm.plan
Interface Task

All Superinterfaces:
Annotatable, Directive, Persistable, PlanningDirective, Priority, Publishable, java.io.Serializable, UniqueObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
MPTask, NewMPTask, NewTask
All Known Implementing Classes:
MPTaskImpl, TaskImpl
public interface Task
extends PlanningDirective, UniqueObject, Priority, Annotatable, Publishable

Task Interface Task is the essential "execute" directive, instructing a subordinate or service provider to plan and eventually accomplish a task. A the general form of a task is: Verb {PrepositionalPhrase} per per

Method Detail

getParentTaskUID

UID getParentTaskUID()
Returns the UID of the base or parent task of a given task, where the given task is an expansion of the base task. The parent task could be "move vehicles from point a to point b ...". An expanded task could be "fuel vehicles ...". UID basetask = fueltask.getParentTaskUID();

Returns:
UID of the Task that is the "parenttask"

getWorkflow

Workflow getWorkflow()
All Tasks are members of a Workflow. The tasks that are expansions of a basetask are placed in one workflow. For example, the fueltask will be a member of a workflow that contains all of the tasks and constraints needed to complete the basetask. 
 Workflow myworkflow = fueltask.getWorkflow();

Returns:
Workflow Returns the Workflow that the task is a member of.

getPrepositionalPhrases

java.util.Enumeration getPrepositionalPhrases()
Returns the prepositional phrase(s) of the Task. A PrepositionalPhrase object contains a String representation of the preposition (from, to, with, etc.) and an object representing the indirect object. The indirect object will be an Asset which can represent an Asset, AssetGroup or Location. For example, in the task "UnitA requisitions commodityB from UnitC"... the PrepositionalPhrase is "from UnitC".

Returns:
An enumeration of PrepositionalPhrases
See Also:
Preposition

getPrepositionalPhrase

PrepositionalPhrase getPrepositionalPhrase(java.lang.String preposition)
Return the first PrepositionalPhrase found with the specified Preposition. Returns null if not found.

Parameters:
preposition - One of the strings named in org.cougaar.planning.ldm.plan.Preposition.

getVerb

Verb getVerb()
The getVerb method returns the verb of the Task. For example, in the Task "fuel vehicles...", the Verb is the object represented by "fuel". 
 Verb mytaskverb = fueltask.getVerb();

Returns:
the Verb of the Task.

getDirectObject

Asset getDirectObject()
Returns the Asset (or AssetGroup) that is being acted upon by the Task. For example, in the task "fuel vehicle 14 ..." the direct object is "vehicle 14".

Returns:
the Direct Object of the task.

getPlan

Plan getPlan()
Description copied from interface: PlanningDirective
This slot is unused and will be removed

Specified by:
getPlan in interface PlanningDirective
Returns:
Plan.RealityPlan -- this slot is unused / deprecated

getPlanElement

PlanElement getPlanElement()
Returns PlanElement that this Task is associated with. Can be used to discern between expandable and non-expandable Tasks. If Task has no PlanElement associated with it, will return null.

getPreferences

java.util.Enumeration getPreferences()
get the preferences on this task.

Returns:
Enumeration{Preference}

getPreference

Preference getPreference(int aspect_type)
return the preference for the given aspect type will return null if there is not a preference defined for this aspect type

Parameters:
aspect_type - The Aspect referenced by the preference

getPreferredValue

double getPreferredValue(int aspect_type)
return the preferred value for a given aspect type from the defined preference (and scoring function) will return Double.NaN if there is not a preference defined for this aspect type

Parameters:
aspect_type - The Aspect referenced by the preference

getPriority

byte getPriority()
Get the priority of this task. Note that this should only be used when there are competing tasks from the SAME customer.

Returns:
The priority of this task
See Also:
Priority

getCommitmentDate

java.util.Date getCommitmentDate()
WARNING: This method may return null if the commitment date is undefined. The task commitment date of a task represents the date past which the planning module will warn if the task is changed or removed. Commitment dates in the planning domain are used to note the last possible date that a task could be changed before the supplier has committed resources to fill or commit the task. E.g. If a supplier has an order and ship lead time of 3 days, then the task's commitment date should be atleast 3 days before the desired delivery date (usually represented with an end date preference).

Returns:
Date The Commitment date of this task.

isDeleted

boolean isDeleted()
Get the deleted status of this task.

getObservableAspects

java.util.Enumeration getObservableAspects()

beforeCommitment

boolean beforeCommitment(java.util.Date currentdate)
Check to see if the current time is before the Commitment date. Will return true if we have not reached the commitment date. Will return true if the commitment date is undefined. Will return false if we have passed the commitment date.

Parameters:
currentdate - The current date.

getAuxiliaryQueryTypes

int[] getAuxiliaryQueryTypes()
Get a collection of the requested AuxiliaryQueryTypes (int). Note: if there are no types set, this will return an array with one element = -1

See Also:
AuxiliaryQueryType

getContext

Context getContext()
Get the problem Context (if any) for this task.

See Also:
Context
